title: Deadline’s Tony Awards Live Blog
description: With quite a bit of critical consensus on who and what should win the prizes at the 78th Annual Tony Awards at Radio City, the night has the potential for being either a get-in-line and hand-out-the-trophies we all expect, or a blow-my-mind-who-could-have-seen-that-coming evening. The critic in me – I’m one of the folks who made […]
author: Patrick Hipes
byline: Greg Evans, Dade Hayes, Erik Pedersen
excerpt: The latest news and updates from the 2025 Tony Awards on June 8.
text: Darren Criss in ‘Maybe Happy Ending’; Jonathan Groff, ‘Just In Time’; Cole Escola in ‘Oh, Mary!’; Audra McDonald, in ‘Gypsy’ and Sarah Snook, in ‘The Picture Of Dorian Gray’ Matthew Murphy Evan Zimmerman/Julieta Cervantes/Marc Brenner With quite a bit of critical consensus on who and what should win the prizes at the 78th Annual Tony Awards at Radio City, the night has the potential for being either a get-in-line and hand-out-the-trophies we all expect, or a blow-my-mind-who-could-have-seen-that-coming evening. The critic in me – I’m one of the folks who made all those predictions and cast my Tony votes – is hoping for the former. But as a person who loves the unexpected in awards shows, I can’t help but also lean a bit into the latter. We’re about to find out, in any case, beginning with the pre-show, The Tony Awards: Act One, which will see awards in some of the technical categories handed out, maybe even a performance award or two if memory serves from last year. The pre-show will be followed immediately with the 78th Tony Awards themselves. Settle in. Watch on Deadline Must Read Stories Read More About: Subscribe to Deadline Get our Breaking News Alerts and Keep your inbox happy. Sign Up
html:
With quite a bit of critical consensus on who and what should win the prizes at the 78th Annual Tony Awards at Radio City, the night has the potential for being either a get-in-line and hand-out-the-trophies we all expect, or a blow-my-mind-who-could-have-seen-that-coming evening. The critic in me – I’m one of the folks who made all those predictions and cast my Tony votes – is hoping for the former. But as a person who loves the unexpected in awards shows, I can’t help but also lean a bit into the latter. We’re about to find out, in any case, beginning with the pre-show, The Tony Awards: Act One, which will see awards in some of the technical categories handed out, maybe even a performance award or two if memory serves from last year. The pre-show will be followed immediately with the 78th Tony Awards themselves. Settle in.
